body.name: Apevia ATX-PR1000 Prestige 1000W 80+ Gold Certified, ROHS Compliance, Active PFC ATX Gaming Power Supply
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 2 hrs
features: Apevia ATX-PR1000 Prestige 1000W 80 Plus Gold Certified & RoHS Compliance Active PFC ATX Gaming Power Supply.
Supports Dual /Quad/Multi-Core CPUs. Supports Single 12V Output for Higher Power Usage

DC to DC Converter Design, Provides Superior Dynamic Response, Greater Sytem Stability and Maximizes the 12V DC Rail OutputMulti-GPU Technologies Supported; 6 Pin and 8 Pin PCI-E Connectors Support all GPU Platforms. Built in 1 x Auto-Thermally Controlled Black 135mm Fan
Multi-GPU Technologies Supported; 6 Pin and 8 Pin PCI-E Connectors Support all GPU Platforms. Built in 1 x Auto-Thermally Controlled Black 135mm Fan

Connectors:1 x 20/24pin Main Power, 1 x 4/8pin 12V, 2 x PCI 6+2pin, 7 x SATA, 4 x Peripheral. Heavy-duty protections, including OVP (Over Voltage Protection), OPP (Over Power Protection), SCP (Short Circuit Protection)

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 74 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Apevia’s Prestige line of power supplies brings great power and efficiency to your computer system. 80+ Gold certified, and designed for elegant form and function, they bring it to life. Supporting the 12v2.3 standard and single rail setup, it’s updated for modern platforms. Boasting a 135mm silent black fan, it keeps everything inside cool. The Prestige line also uses Active PFC, with a 99% factor correction, boosting performance and saving energy. No toggle switch included, the power supply automatically switches between 110V and 230V depending on the power grid its attached to. ROHS certified. 600W Power with 13.5cm black fan80+ Gold & ROHS certifiedHigh stability with 5% tolerance of 5V, 3.3V & 12V outputHigh quality components and housingUniversal AC input by active PFC (99%PF Typical)Package contentsHeavy-duty protections, including OVP (Over Voltage Protection), OPP (Over Power Protection), SCP (Short Circuit Protection) ‍IMPORTANT: The power supply will not power on simply by connecting the power cord to both the power supply and wall outlet. Ensure that all the power supply cables are properly connected to the PC for it to power on. IMPORTANT: The 8pin CPU connector can be split apart to become a 4+4 connector by pushing one end of the 4pin down and the other end of the 4pin up for motherboards that require a 4pin power connector. IMPORTANT: The 8pin PCI-E GPU connector can be split apart to become a 6+2 connector by pushing one end of the 6pin down and the other end of the 2pin up for graphics cards that require a 6pin power connector. IMPORTANT: The 24pin motherboard connector can be split apart to become a 20+4 connector by pushing one end of the 20pin down and the other end of the 4pin up for motherboards that require a 20pin power connector

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Ignoring the bad publicity this companies PSU's have received in the past, this is not the same piece o'crap that they use to be. These are made entirely different. Very nice build quality. Cables are of adequate length for an eATX build/case, with plenty of connections.Using it with a 135w max draw CPU and a 250w max draw GPU, plus the draw from X99 workstation and SSD drives. More than appropriate. PSU fan runs efficiently and quiet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An excellent unit.
reviews.reviewText: This power suply works perfectly. It's a very quit unit and it's feeding my CPU Ryzen 7 7800x3D and GPU RX 7900XTX.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Delivery time

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Package was not sealed, at first feel like the top was little shaky, but works ok.
reviews.reviewText: Good things are, it arrive on time, easy to install, and so far it works ok and quietly...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works nice and quiet
reviews.reviewText: While its size did eliminate a drive bay in my htpc case, i still had room for 3 drives, 2 hdd 8 tb, and 1 tb ssd.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My fault ( I thought was a full module )
reviews.reviewText: So I bought for my wife computer . I am impress with it the cable are long enough for the job. The price is great . It quiet no fans noise. Power is great . It running amd 3900x 128gig 3200mzh memory, 6900xt video card. one m.2 ( 2tb ) and 2 m.2 (1tb) 240 aio cooler. 6 case fans. If module buy again, I still would buy for a back up , because price great or even use it for i do bench test my new build.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for a mid level gaming build
reviews.reviewText: I probably should have gotten a 1200 but I just squeezed by with this one msi board liquid cooled ryzen 8 processor 12gb of vram 2 separate boards 1 tb m.2 on the board 32gb of dram and 3 tb ssd 1 tb each A total of 12 led fans it’s not over the limit but It’s pushing it wait 13 fan’s it has one to. Nice unit.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Spent a year trying to troubleshoot an issue caused by this part
reviews.reviewText: This power supply works fine... under a light load. Which is why I spent over a year trying to figure out why my computer would lock up and freeze at random when completing heavy graphics load tasks like gaming, livestreaming, and rendering 3D models, but benchmark tests continued to indicate my GPU, CPU, etc. were fine.Turns out this power supply often fails when the power draw spikes (a notorious problem with the NVIDIA 30 series) and rather than completely shutting down, it would hang and could only be resolved with a hard reset. Replacing the power supply with another brand completely resolved the problem.

Had a 650w Corsair previously without any issues, but added another GPU so needed to go up a size for my PSU. Thought I'd give this unit a try because of the price point. Well I wasted my money for sure, PC now blips out every 20 minutes. Reverted to the old Corsair which is running things again however according to my watt meter it is maximized right now. Looks like I am upgrading "again" very soon. Wouldn't suggest this power supply for anything. Giving it a 2 star only because it turns on, and probably will work for a basic low end PC arrangement.
Todo el power a muy buen precio
